item.title: England Football Legend Alan Shearer: Why Premier League Is Best - Forbes
item.description:
England Football Legend Alan Shearer: Why Premier League Is Best  Forbes

Toon legend: Newcastle United captain Alan Shearer celebrates after scoring against Premier League rival Sunderland, April 17, 2006, in Sunderland, England (Photo by Stu Forster/Getty Images) Alan Shearer is one of those names synonymous with the game of English football. During his time as a center forward for England, Shearer scored 30 goals in 62 international appearances. But Shearer really made his mark as a legend in the English Premier League, scoring 283 goals overall in the top flight of English football, 148 of which were scored for Newcastle United, his beloved hometown club. She...

item.title: Redemption for Jordan Pickford but Everton miss out on fifth straight home win - The Telegraph
item.description:
Redemption for Jordan Pickford but Everton miss out on fifth straight home win  The Telegraph

If late drama and Jordan Pickford have gone hand in hand this week, at least he could savour it this time. After the England international condemned Everton to defeat in the Merseyside derby, this time he preserved a point. A fine save from Christian Atsu amounted to a moment of redemption for England’s No. 1. Once again, though, Everton could rue the antics of an opposing goalkeeper. Like Alisson three days earlier, Martin Dubravka made an extraordinary save as Marco Silva’s side were denied a fifth straight victory on their own turf. In the process, the Slovakian secured the sort of hard-...

item.title: Everton vs Newcastle: Marco Silva hails Jordan Pickford as he bounces back from derby mistake - The Independent
item.description:
Everton vs Newcastle: Marco Silva hails Jordan Pickford as he bounces back from derby mistake  The Independent

Marco Silva hailed Jordan Pickford after a late save from the England goalkeeper ensured Everton claimed a point against Newcastle. Pickford denied Christian Atsu four minutes from time at Goodison Park as a tight Premier League encounter ended 1-1. It had been a difficult few days for Pickford after a late blunder in Sunday's derby against Liverpool at Anfield proved costly. Everton boss Silva said: "It is a normal situation for him, with his quality. I didn't see anything different from the previous game at home. It is normal with his quality and he helped the team again. It's nothing new...

item.title: Kurt Zouma wants Everton response against Watford after frustration of Newcastle draw - The Independent
item.description:
Kurt Zouma wants Everton response against Watford after frustration of Newcastle draw  The Independent

Kurt Zouma refused to dwell on missed opportunities after Everton were held to a frustrating 1-1 draw by Newcastle on Wednesday. Everton did climb back up to sixth in the Premier League after recovering from the shock of conceding early to the defence-minded Newcastle side at Goodison Park, but they spurned some gilt-edged chances to claim victory. Marco Silva's side, who had been hoping to bounce back after Sunday's agonising last-gasp derby defeat at Liverpool, are eight points behind fifth-placed Arsenal ahead of this weekend's clash with Watford. “Everybody is disappointed with the resu...

item.title: Burnley vs Brighton, Premier League: Prediction, what time, what channel, how to stream online, team news, odds and more - The Independent
item.description:
Burnley vs Brighton, Premier League: Prediction, what time, what channel, how to stream online, team news, odds and more  The Independent

A Burnley side struggling for form welcome Brighton to Turf Moor on Saturday afternoon. Sean Dyche’s team lost in midweek after surrendering a one-goal lead against Liverpool, and are without a win in eight league games; they come into the weekend in 19th place on nine points. Brighton have had an excellent start to the season, and their 3-1 win against rivals Crystal Palace in midweek after going a man down will only add to the feel-good factor on the south coast; they’re in 10th, on 21 points. What time does it start? Burnley vs Brighton kicks off at 3:00pm (GMT) on Saturday 8th December....

item.title: Newcastle owner Mike Ashley looking at four bids in excess of £300m for club - The Guardian
item.description:
Newcastle owner Mike Ashley looking at four bids in excess of £300m for club  The Guardian

Mike Ashley is considering four bids in excess of £300m for Newcastle United as the owner attempts to push through a sale before January. The sportswear tycoon revealed on Monday evening that he was in talks with several potential purchasers 14 months after placing the club on the market, and voiced his hope that a deal could be done within weeks. Related: Rafael Benítez remains diplomatic on subject of protest by Newcastle fans It is understood there are at least four interested parties, all of them based overseas, who have tabled offers and that talks are continuing amid optimism that Ash...

item.title: Everton vs Newcastle United: Premier League preview, team news, predicted line-ups, plus more - talkSPORT
item.description:
Everton vs Newcastle United: Premier League preview, team news, predicted line-ups, plus more  talkSPORT

Everton have an immediate opportunity to bounce back from Merseyside derby heartache when Newcastle visit Goodison Park on Wednesday. Just three days after Divock Origi’s injury-time winner downed a spirited Toffees side, Marco Silva will be hoping his team is able to respond against the Magpies. Silva’s side put in a spirited display against Liverpool Both teams suffered defeats over the weekend despite heading into matchday 13 in good form, with Newcastle beaten 3-0 at home by West Ham the day before Liverpool triumphed over their local rivals at Anfield. A win for Everton on Wednesday co...
